nodes.Description:
CWE-590: Free of Memory not on the Heap
The product calls free() on a pointer to memory that was not allocated using associated heap allocation functions such as malloc(), calloc(), or realloc().
nodes.label: Free of Memory not on the Heap

nodes.Description:
CWE-1239: Improper Zeroization of Hardware Register
The hardware product does not properly clear sensitive information from built-in registers when the user of the hardware block changes.
nodes.label: Improper Zeroization of Hardware Register

nodes.Description:
CWE-761: Free of Pointer not at Start of Buffer
The product calls free() on a pointer to a memory resource that was allocated on the heap, but the pointer is not at the start of the buffer.
nodes.label: Free of Pointer not at Start of Buffer

nodes.Description:
CWE-401: Missing Release of Memory after Effective Lifetime
The product does not sufficiently track and release allocated memory after it has been used, which slowly consumes remaining memory.
nodes.label: Missing Release of Memory after Effective Lifetime

nodes.Description:
CWE-1342: Information Exposure through Microarchitectural State after Transient Execution
The processor does not properly clear microarchitectural state after incorrect microcode assists or speculative execution, resulting in transient execution.
nodes.label: Information Exposure through Microarchitectural State after Transient Execution

nodes.Description:
CWE-404: Improper Resource Shutdown or Release
The product does not release or incorrectly releases a resource before it is made available for re-use.
nodes.label: Improper Resource Shutdown or Release

nodes.Description:
CWE-1091: Use of Object without Invoking Destructor Method
The product contains a method that accesses an object but does not later invoke the element's associated finalize/destructor method.
nodes.label: Use of Object without Invoking Destructor Method

nodes.Description:
CWE-1330: Remanent Data Readable after Memory Erase
Confidential information stored in memory circuits is readable or recoverable after being cleared or erased.
nodes.label: Remanent Data Readable after Memory Erase

nodes.Description:
CWE-1266: Improper Scrubbing of Sensitive Data from Decommissioned Device
The product does not properly provide a capability for the product administrator to remove sensitive data at the time the product is decommissioned. A scrubbing capability could be missing, insufficient, or incorrect.
nodes.label: Improper Scrubbing of Sensitive Data from Decommissioned Device

nodes.Description:
CWE-244: Improper Clearing of Heap Memory Before Release ('Heap Inspection')
Using realloc() to resize buffers that store sensitive information can leave the sensitive information exposed to attack, because it is not removed from memory.
nodes.label: Improper Clearing of Heap Memory Before Release ('Heap Inspection')

nodes.Description:
CWE-1301: Insufficient or Incomplete Data Removal within Hardware Component
The product's data removal process does not completely delete all data and potentially sensitive information within hardware components.
nodes.label: Insufficient or Incomplete Data Removal within Hardware Component

nodes.Description:
CWE-299: Improper Check for Certificate Revocation
The product does not check or incorrectly checks the revocation status of a certificate, which may cause it to use a certificate that has been compromised.
nodes.label: Improper Check for Certificate Revocation

nodes.Description:
CWE-762: Mismatched Memory Management Routines
The product attempts to return a memory resource to the system, but it calls a release function that is not compatible with the function that was originally used to allocate that resource.
nodes.label: Mismatched Memory Management Routines

nodes.Description:
CWE-459: Incomplete Cleanup
The product does not properly "clean up" and remove temporary or supporting resources after they have been used.
nodes.label: Incomplete Cleanup

nodes.Description:
CWE-1272: Sensitive Information Uncleared Before Debug/Power State Transition
The product performs a power or debug state transition, but it does not clear sensitive information that should no longer be accessible due to changes to information access restrictions.
nodes.label: Sensitive Information Uncleared Before Debug/Power State Transition

nodes.Description:
CWE-763: Release of Invalid Pointer or Reference
The product attempts to return a memory resource to the system, but it calls the wrong release function or calls the appropriate release function incorrectly.
nodes.label: Release of Invalid Pointer or Reference

nodes.Description:
CWE-226: Sensitive Information in Resource Not Removed Before Reuse
The product releases a resource such as memory or a file so that it can be made available for reuse, but it does not clear or "zeroize" the information contained in the resource before the product performs a critical state transition or makes the resource available for reuse by other entities.
nodes.label: Sensitive Information in Resource Not Removed Before Reuse

nodes.Description:
CWE-460: Improper Cleanup on Thrown Exception
The product does not clean up its state or incorrectly cleans up its state when an exception is thrown, leading to unexpected state or control flow.
nodes.label: Improper Cleanup on Thrown Exception

nodes.Description:
CWE-775: Missing Release of File Descriptor or Handle after Effective Lifetime
The product does not release a file descriptor or handle after its effective lifetime has ended, i.e., after the file descriptor/handle is no longer needed.
nodes.label: Missing Release of File Descriptor or Handle after Effective Lifetime

nodes.Description:
CWE-370: Missing Check for Certificate Revocation after Initial Check
The product does not check the revocation status of a certificate after its initial revocation check, which can cause the product to perform privileged actions even after the certificate is revoked at a later time.
nodes.label: Missing Check for Certificate Revocation after Initial Check

nodes.Description:
CWE-772: Missing Release of Resource after Effective Lifetime
The product does not release a resource after its effective lifetime has ended, i.e., after the resource is no longer needed.
nodes.label: Missing Release of Resource after Effective Lifetime

nodes.Description:
CWE-568: finalize() Method Without super.finalize()
The product contains a finalize() method that does not call super.finalize().
nodes.label: finalize() Method Without super.finalize()
